frameDefinitions: A physical entity, construed as a point-Sound_source, emits a Sound.
An Agent makes a particular facial expression, generally in response to some Internal_cause (generally an emotional state).
An Entity (generally food) is exposed to a Heat_source whose Temperature may also be specified.
The words in this frame refer to facial Expressions and the Possessors of those Expressions.
The Hearer receives a Message or communication on a particular Topic.
While in motion, an Impactor makes sudden, forcible contact with the Impactee, or two Impactors both move, mutually making forcible contact.
frameExamples: His eyes <t>smile</t>, but his lips do not.
Bacon was <t>frying</t> in the pan, and a great heap of eggs already lay steaming on a plate.
Teenage fans first <t>heard</t> about the tragedy on a popular radio show.
The massive metal foot <t>hit</t> the ground with a huge thud.
listRoleDefinitions: The frame element <fen>Sound_source</fen> is assigned to a constituent referring to a physical entity which emits a sound. Such an entity must have an appropriately complex internal structure such that it can create a sound. For example, a machine or some other thing with moving parts can create sound by itself.

The frame element <fen>Sound</fen> is incorporated in the meaning of the verbs of this frame. Otherwise, this role is assigned to NPs which actually refer to a sound in the presence of the target. This typically occurs when the target is a verb used as a modifier in its <ment>-ing</ment> form, e.g.:
An event in which one or more <fen>Sound_source</fen>s participate and which is accompanied by <fen>Sound</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Noisy_event</fen> occurs.

The location of the <fen>Sound_source</fen>. This role differs from <fen>Location_of_source</fen> only in terms of point of view; the latter role implies a point of view that is not on the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
The individual that assumes a particular facial expression.
The particular part of the face that the <fen>Agent</fen> moves into a facial expression.
The point in time at which the change in facial_expression takes place.
The <fen>Entity</fen> (often a food item)  that absorbs heat.
The <fen>Container</fen> that holds the <fen>Entity</fen> that absorbs the heat.
This role identifies the object that directly supplies heat to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the heat absorption takes place.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application occurs.
This is the <fen>Expression</fen> made.
This is the person who exhibitis the <fen>Expression</fen>.
The emotion that is conveyed by a particular <fen>Expression</fen>.
This role is the person who receives a Message. It is expressed as an Exteranal Argument in this frame:
The Message is the content that is communicated from one person to another. It is normally expressed as an NP Object or a finite clause Complement:
Topic is the subject matter about which the Message is communicated. It is normally expressed as a PP-complement headed by <ment>about</ment>, with or without a quantificational noun:
The <fen>Time</fen> the <fen>Hearer</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen>.
The entity that hits the <fen>Impactee</fen>.
The entity which is hit by the <fen>Impactor</fen>.
The multiple entities that collide.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The wind</fex> howled.
The branches made a rattling <fex>sound</fex>.
<fex>The conversations</fex> droned on
It's going to beep again <fex>in two minutes</fex>.
A bat squeaked <fex>over our heads</fex>.
<fex>Bacon</fex> frying in the pan and scenting the air
Five fat sausages were frying <fex>in the pan</fex>
Food was placed to sizzle <fex>on the barbecue </fex>.
<fex>Five minutes ago</fex>the eggs weren't boiling yet.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex> the meat sizzled in the oven and a big pan of potatoes stood on the hob
He gave a wide <fex>grin</fex>.
<fex>Ryan</fex> grinned.
He had an <fex>angry</fex> expression.
<fex>The students</fex> heard from Pat that class was canceled.
The students heard <fex>the news</fex>.
The students heard <fex>about class</fex>.
I heard <fex>in June</fex> that Pablo left, how sad!
<fex>The rock</fex> hit the sand with a thump.
The rock hit <fex>the sand</fex> with a thump.
<fex>The car and truck</fex> collided at a combined speed of over 100MPH.
